Question: How do I write a recursive method that takes as an input an ArrayList of Integers and returns the smallest integer?: :This is regularly how it's done but it has to be recursively with no for, do-while, and while loops. if statements only.import java.util.ArrayList;import java.util.Scanner;public class arrayex1 {    public static void main(String[] args) {        Scanner input = new Scanner(System.in);        ArrayList<Integer> numbers = new ArrayList<Integer>();        System.out.println("Enter numbers: ");        for (int i = 0; i < 10; i++) {            int num = input.nextInt();            numbers.add(num);        }        for (int i = 0; i < numbers.size(); i++) {            if (numbers.get(findMin(numbers)) == i) { // If the 'smallest' index value is equal to i.                System.out.println(numbers.get(i) + " <== Smallest number");            } else {                System.out.println(numbers.get(i));            }        }    }    public static int findMin(ArrayList<Integer> n) {        int min = 0; // Get value at index position 0 as the current smallest.        for (int i = 0; i < n.size(); i++) {            if (n.get(i) < min) {                min = i;            }        }         return min;    }}
Please using this api: Iterator.next.

Question: How do I write a recursive method that takes as an input an ArrayList of Integers and returns the smallest integer?: :This is regularly how it's done but it has to be recursively with no for, do-while, and while loops. if statements only.import java.util.ArrayList;import java.util.Scanner;public class arrayex1 {    public static void main(String[] args) {        Scanner input = new Scanner(System.in);        ArrayList<Integer> numbers = new ArrayList<Integer>();        System.out.println("Enter numbers: ");        for (int i = 0; i < 10; i++) {            int num = input.nextInt();            numbers.add(num);        }        for (int i = 0; i < numbers.size(); i++) {            if (numbers.get(findMin(numbers)) == i) { // If the 'smallest' index value is equal to i.                System.out.println(numbers.get(i) + " <== Smallest number");            } else {                System.out.println(numbers.get(i));            }        }    }    public static int findMin(ArrayList<Integer> n) {        int min = 0; // Get value at index position 0 as the current smallest.        for (int i = 0; i < n.size(); i++) {            if (n.get(i) < min) {                min = i;            }        }         return min;    }}
Please using this api: Iterator.next.
Answer: Here is the recursive method that takes an ArrayList of Integers and returns the smallest integer:

<<<api>>>: Iterator.next
<<<code>>>: 
```java
public static int findMin(ArrayList<Integer> n) {
    Iterator<Integer> iterator = n.iterator();
    int min = iterator.next(); // Get the first value as the current smallest.
    return findMinRecursive(iterator, min);
}

public static int findMinRecursive(Iterator<Integer> iterator, int min) {
    if (!iterator.hasNext()) { // If there are no more elements, return the current smallest.
        return min;
    } else {
        int next = iterator.next(); // Get the next value.
        if (next < min) { // If the next value is smaller than the current smallest, update the smallest.
            min = next;
        }
        return findMinRecursive(iterator, min); // Recursive call with the updated smallest.
    }
}
```
<<<explanation>>>: The method `findMin` initializes the smallest value as the first element of the ArrayList and calls the recursive method `findMinRecursive`. The recursive method keeps track of the smallest value and updates it whenever it finds a smaller value. The recursion ends when there are no more elements in the ArrayList. The smallest value is then returned.

Please note that this solution uses the Iterator.next method to access the elements of the ArrayList. This method is used in a recursive way to find the smallest integer in the ArrayList.
